author: nhcwebmaster@noaa.gov (NHC Webmaster)
nhc_headline: ...DISTURBANCE EXPECTED TO BECOME A TROPICAL STORM TODAY... ...BRINGING HEAVY RAINS, COASTAL FLOODING, AND GUSTY WINDS TO THE COASTS OF TEXAS AND NORTHEASTERN MEXICO THROUGH THURSDAY...
summary:
...DISTURBANCE EXPECTED TO BECOME A TROPICAL STORM TODAY... ...BRINGING HEAVY RAINS, COASTAL FLOODING, AND GUSTY WINDS TO THE COASTS OF TEXAS AND NORTHEASTERN MEXICO THROUGH THURSDAY...
 As of 4:00 AM CDT Wed Jun 19
 the center of One was located near 22.7, -93.8
 with movement WNW at 8 mph.
 The minimum central pressure was 998 mb
 with maximum sustained winds of about 40 mph.

title: Summary - Potential Tropical Cyclone One (AT1/AL012024)
